message.content:
### Current Status
As of October 2024, OpenAI has **not launched GPT-5**. No official release date has been announced. CEO Sam Altman has stated that GPT-5 is in development but requires further advancements in safety, reliability, and capabilities before release.

### Key Statements from OpenAI
- **July 2024 (Sam Altman on X/Twitter)**: Altman confirmed GPT-5 is "still a ways off," emphasizing the need for more compute and research. [Source: Sam Altman's X post](https://x.com/sama/status/1816029054538475957)
- **September 2024 (OpenAI Blog/Events)**: OpenAI released **o1** (formerly "Strawberry"), a reasoning-focused model family, as a major interim step. No GPT-5 mention. [Source: OpenAI o1 Announcement](https://openai.com/index/introducing-openai-o1-preview/)
- **October 2024 (DevDay)**: OpenAI unveiled **o1-pro** and API expansions, but skipped GPT-5 details. Altman reiterated focus on "next-generation" models without specifics. [Source: OpenAI DevDay Recap](https://openai.com/index/devday-2024/)

### Rumors and Speculation
- Leaks suggest training involves massive compute (e.g., 10x GPT-4 scale), but unverified.
- Expected features: Multimodal (text, image, video), advanced reasoning, agentic capabilities.
- Analysts predict **late 2025** at earliest, pending regulatory hurdles. [Source: Reuters Report (Aug 2024)](https://www.reuters.com/technology/artificial-intelligence/openai-aims-release-google-gemini-level-model-by-end-year-2024-08-14/)

For updates, monitor [OpenAI's Blog](https://openai.com/blog/) or [Sam Altman's X](https://x.com/sama).
